comments.html: Hopefully we'll see some BGP Add-Path implemented in more "real production" deployments along with PIC :) It's been a while since they have been kicking it down the IETF hallways...

comments.name: kierkegaard

comments.html:
Yes using different RDs to advertise unique VPNv4 prefixes through RR
http://blog.shafagh.com/2010/09/05/bgp-multipath-part-two/
comments.name: Shafagh Zandi

comments.html:
Who am I to go against the community-agreed terminology ;) Changed the heading and the text (thank you!).

Also, you HAVE TO enable IBGP multipath on PE-C and PE-D, otherwise they will not install additional BGP routes into the VRF routing table. Somehow I had the feeling it wasn't needed, but a quick lab test proved otherwise.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: FYI, it still says "load balancing" in the RSS title

comments.html: What would happen, if the CE routers in the multihomed site advertises the prefixes with two different metric values ( i.e CE1 = 150, CE2 = 250 )? . Will the RR can have two entries ?/
comments.name: Frank

comments.html: Keep in mind that without add-path the route reflector selects a single route and propagates its best route to its clients.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

address-family vpnv4
bgp additional-paths install
